question: Question_01_(c)
sols:
If we use the substitution

\[\displaystyle u=2y+y^2\] then

\[\displaystyle du=(2+2y)\,dy =2(1+y)\,dy\] and

\begin{align*} \int_0^1 (y+1)\sqrt{2y+y^2}\,  dy &= \frac12 \int_0^3 \sqrt{u}\, du\\
&= \frac12 \left[\frac23 u^{3/2}\right]_0^3\\
&= \frac13 3^{3/2} \\
&= \sqrt3.
\end{align*}
